definition: to lisp/unclear articulation/inarticulate
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
tooth/CL:顆|颗[ke1]
(negative prefix)/not/no
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: At that time his both legs were unable to walk normally, speak some enunciations not to be unclear.
sentences.chinese: 當時他的雙腿就無法正常行走，說話有些口齒不清。

sentences.english: Whilst starting to learn lisp, I've come across the term tail-recursive.
sentences.chinese: 雖然開始學習口齒不清，我遇到這個詞的尾遞歸的。
那孩子口齒不清地禱告。
她口齒不清地做了一個回答。

sentences.english: The little boy lisped out his story.
sentences.chinese: 小男孩口齒不清地講了他的故事。

sentences.english: Leave an inarticulate, angry comment below.
sentences.chinese: 留下一段口齒不清的，怒火中燒的評論吧。

sentences.english: The pupil lisped out the answer.
sentences.chinese: 小學生口齒不清地說出答案。

sentences.english: In other words, shaking their hips, and lisping.
sentences.chinese: 換言之，搖動臀部，口齒不清。

sentences.english: Inarticulate beasts is what I would term such people.
sentences.chinese: 口齒不清的野獸是我長期這樣的人。

sentences.english: Finally, there is the much-misdescribed "gay lisp".
sentences.chinese: 最後，就是這個經常被誤解的“同志型口齒不清”。

definition: hum/drone/buzz
overjoyed (idiom); as pleased as punch
flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
obscene language
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
vivid and colorful (idiom); true to life/lively and realistic
overbearing/arrogant bully
improvisation
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
lit. to hate iron for not becoming steel/to feel resentful towards sb for failing to meet expectations and impatient to see improvement (idiom)
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
to have no sense of shame/brazen
medical doctor/physician who works primarily by administering drugs, as opposed to surgeon 外科醫生|外科医生[wai4 ke1 yi1 sheng1]
to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
